top_comments_top.body:
Not sure how the switch version feels but I played both games on gamepass on Xbox so.. the amount of cash I saved with gamepass overtime was more what I was focusing on.

I liked it on Xbox fine

I experienced it on Xbox with a 5.1 surround system. The audio and graphics are just awesome and might not feel like that on the switch, depending on if you are playing your switch as mobile console or if you use your TV dock. I also own a switch, but did not play Ori on it. I would, however, prefer the Xbox Controller to play it with, due to some fast and good timed button presses you will need to do during the game. So I would recommend the Xbox version.

I just finished the first game on the switch and it ran flawlessly from start to finish and looked stunning. I got the double pack that just launched as a birthday present, so if you want a physical copy there's that too.
The duology is regularly on sale for less than £15 on Steam, pretty good deal for some good games
I got it on Xbox One. It's been sitting there unused for years so I figured I should make use of it.
